text:
Fun fact: The song Bayou Boogie was actually inspired somewhat by "In the Air Tonight". David Wise, the creator of the soundtrack, said that he was a big fan of Phil Collins and the resemblance is not a coincidence.

Source: Sheeeit, I read that in an online article years ago. I'd struggle to name the website, but I'm sure you can find the info with a quick Google search. :)

text: megaman x (at least the first 3), the dkc trilogy, ff from 4 to 7 (i havent finished ff8 and 9, so i cant tell if their osts are good), pokemon 1st and 2nd generation (r/s/e may be good, but not as good), zelda oot, alttp and links awakenig, super metroid, earthbound, super mario rpg...

author: Sega Starbits

text:
One more thing I wanted to say - actually it's not the developer's fault that games get worse and worse - sure, they make it, but we buy them. We accept them. And sadly, we love them. Hear all those people shouting every year OMFG CoD (insert anything here) is the best game ever. They do it every year on the same game. 
Not just the industry has changed, but we as players also did.  The most did. Some still know about the magic in games...
author: Michael Hagedorn

text:
@teganyavo 
exactly - you can compare it to the movie industry - the 3D technology is kinda an excuse for horrible storyline. I mean come on, what movie had a decent story line over the past years? Inception? That's what I mean...
author: Michael Hagedorn

text:
@orlandod84 
no - graphics get better, physics too - but besides that? storylines get simpler and therefore more boring, characters are made effortless and there is no love for details anymore. Compare DK COuntry for example with all its easter eggs and lovely designed stages to a modern video game which you have played thru in 3 hours. Graphics aren't everything. They don't make a good game. Many things were better back then, and for me those are the important things.
author: Michael Hagedorn

text: @revanskywalker games become worse and worse? pff yeah right! video games keep getting better and better! don't let nostalgia cloud your judgment. the only thing that has changed is your perspective.... you just don't like video games as much as you did as a kid and you rationalize that games now just suck

author: Mesmurize

text: Also, @ TalesofGod, I got to disagree with you about saying that all older games had bad visuals. Games with good graphics are that way because of a good art style, and while consoles now can have a much wider range in their art style ( CPU intensive 3d graphics and such), there are older games that look good still because their art style could be done even with many graphical limitations. Kirby's Adventure in Dreamland is still a really good looking and sounding game to me.
author: Madoculos

text:
@thosechosenby
I won't say that there are no new games coming out that are good, or have a lack good music. How ever, I do believe that there are way too many games that focus on "epic" visuals and  "epic" music. It's a bunch  of explosions and artificially emotional music (you know, like orchestra noise all the time now; most developers don't  care about. memorable melodies for the most part). It sucks.

text: I actually did that, but my laptop is the kind that doesn't let you press more than 2 keys at the same time so I can't do a running jump (I kept dying when I tried to get into the first bonus barrel in the second stage).  I can probably find the GBA version used for <$10.
author: OhGoodAFarce

text: Just a suggestion, but you can download a SNES emulator, I use ZSnes 9x.  Easy and simple to use.  Then all you have to do is search for the Donkey Kong Country 2 ROM, download it, and you should be ready to go.

author: Earthsong9405

text: Close your eyes, block out everything else and think back to your childhood playing this game. The undertone bass at 21 seconds, the the mellow pipe chords on 26 seconds, the soothing melody at 57 seconds. A touch higher at 1min 07 and then Whack ! at 1min 15. Could this music be any better.... So so talented.
